definitions: To cause to operate, move, or happen at the same time or rate.
To make something correspond in time or sequence.
To adjust a clock or watch to show the same time as another.
To make data or files consistent across multiple devices or locations.
examples: The dancers need to synchronize their movements.
We will synchronize our watches before the mission.
The software helps synchronize files between your computer and phone.
The two events failed to synchronize.
